intro: Cerastium fontanum subsp. scoticum, commonly known as Scottish mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are white or pale pink, typically appearing in clusters at the ends of stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
